direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the presence of an option, but one checks the short name and the other checks the long name.
Both methods check for the presence of an option, but hasOption checks both short and long names.
Both methods involve retrieving or checking options based on a string key, with similar control flows.
Both methods modify the state of the Options object by adding or checking options.
Both methods access and process options based on string inputs, though with different purposes.

enhanced_by.reason: Adding options is necessary to set up the state for checking short options.
hasOption can be used to check for the presence of an option before or after hasShortOption.
getOption can be used to retrieve the option for further assertions after checking its presence.
